word: The father frequently comes in with a self-satisfied air, and proudly recounts what he has accomplished during the day. . . .She has not done much except take care of the children, cook the meals, and keep the house in order. She has not acted the merchant, bought nor sold; she has not acted the farmer, in tilling the soil; she has not acted the mechanic-- therefore she has done nothing to make her weary. . . .
